common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing "Connection refused" or "Route not found" errors when trying to connect to Pieces OS on ports 1000 or 39300. This might be due to Pieces OS migrating to a new port range. Ensure your Pieces OS version is up-to-date and check the port-finding algorithm.

related_issues.title: Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
related_issues.text:
Getting Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to include the Pieces OS endpoint (127.0.0.1:1000) into my external project, but even though Pieces OS is operating, I keep getting the error "Connection refused."

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* Raju-git20 reported an issue with PieceOS not working ("Not Working").
* Pieces-support-bot triaged the issue and suggested some helpful resources.
* Mark-at-pieces explained that PiecesOS migrated to a new port (39300) with version 11.0.0.
* Raju-git20 tried the new port but it didn't work.
* Mark-at-pieces further clarified that POS checks a range of ports starting from 39300.
* Raju-git20 mentioned they are building a Python code for Linkedin scraping and application and would like to schedule a call for discussion and feedback.

**Problems Identified:**

* Raju-git20 couldn't access PieceOS after the port migration.
* The problem persisted even after trying the new port mentioned by Mark-at-pieces.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggested checking the port-finding algorithm and the port-finding range of POS.
* They offered to connect Raju-git20 with the appropriate individuals at Pieces for further assistance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue seems unresolved with Raju-git20 requesting a call for further discussion and feedback.

**Additional Notes:**

* Raju-git20's project involves Python code for Linkedin scraping and application with AI integration.

related_issues.title: Getting an error of Route not found error
related_issues.text:
Getting an error of Route not found error
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The problem "route not found" appears whenever I attempt to access the pieces os endpoint on port 39300.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d4f8961a-afa1-401d-82b5-cc2ead804b9f)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary
**Key Points Raised:**

* Raju-git20 reported an issue with port connection.
* They encountered an error message: "connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:1000".

**Problems Identified:**

* Potential invalid port number in the URL.
* Difficulty identifying the correct port for Pieces Core Services.
* Raju-git20 was seeking help with a project they were building.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggested checking the POS version and related resources.
* They explained the port range used by POS and the port-finding algorithm.
* They offered to connect Raju-git20 with relevant Pieces personnel.
* The issue was closed as it continued an existing discussion. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The conversation moved to issue #597, likely for further troubleshooting and project development assistance. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was addressed within the promised 24-hour timeframe. 
* Mark-at-pieces provided helpful information and support to Raju-git20. 
* The conversation highlights Pieces' commitment to assisting developers and resolving technical issues.

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Service Accessibility Issues
common_issues.description: Users are reporting difficulties accessing Pieces Copilot Service on Linux and Windows. Issues range from font customization requests to service launch errors. Troubleshooting steps include checking dependencies, reviewing installation logs, and engaging Pieces support for live debugging assistance.

related_issues.title: How to change the font of the linux app?
related_issues.text:
How to change the font of the linux app? ### Discussed in https://github.com/pieces-app/support/discussions/600
Originally posted by **rafidahmed816** January 27, 2025 The font is too bold. Can I change the font style? ![Screenshot from 2025-01-27 16-30-12](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fc48f057-36b7-4645-89b8-373702db6fdc)
## GitHub Issue Summary: Font Customization in Pieces Copilot Chats **Key Points Raised:** * User @rafidahmed816 inquired about the ability to customize the font within Pieces Copilot chats and the sidebar. * Currently, there is no setting available for font customization. **Problems Identified:** * Lack of user control over the font used in the chat and sidebar. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * The developer, @mack-at-pieces, suggests exploring the introduction of a font customization setting. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The developer has confirmed the user's request and plans to document it on their roadmap for future consideration. * No concrete solution has been implemented yet. **Additional Information:** * The user confirmed that their request refers specifically to the font within the Pieces Copilot chats and the sidebar, not the Windows title bar. * This issue remains open and awaiting further updates from the developer.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: Bad state: GetIt: Object/factory with type PiecesWebSocketCreator is not registered inside GetIt. 
(Did you accidentally do GetIt sl=GetIt.instance(); instead of GetIt sl=GetIt.instance;
Did you forget to register it?)

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: false
Path: 

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: d577e8e9-3d15-402f-b1f8-4b925e53849a
User: b827c171-d5b6-4aca-81fd-27d0ac789fcb
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39301

**Device Information**

Operating System: Linux
Current Version: Linux 6.8.0-51-generic #52-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Thu Dec  5 13:09:44 UTC 2024
Min Version Supported: Ubuntu 18
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @Sahil-kushwaha is experiencing an issue where they are unable to open Pieces Copilot Service.
* The issue has been automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user is unable to access the Pieces Copilot Service.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The user is directed to several resources, including other similar issues, documentation, and a YouTube channel.
* The Pieces team will follow up with the user within 24 hours.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently being investigated by the Pieces team.
* The user is awaiting a response from the team.

**Additional Information:**

* This issue is similar to other reported issues regarding the inability to open Pieces Copilot Service.
* The provided resources may offer potential solutions or workarounds.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ceec7f4-768a-43cc-b06d-25a14c6d4e94)

I have this issue with opening Pieces and is checking updates and it does reload many times, need help asap
## GitHub Issue Summary: 

**Key points:**
* User (@CPX10) reported issues with Pieces Core Services not being accessible and seeing non-dismissable overlay messages.
* Support bot suggested related issues and resources.
* @mark-at-pieces acknowledged the issue and tagged other team members for deeper investigation.
* @mack-at-pieces proposed scheduling a video call with the user for live troubleshooting.

**Problems identified:**

* User is unable to access Pieces Core Services.
* User sees non-dismissable overlay messages.
* Difficulty debugging the issue without a live session.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* User is suggested to book a video call with @mack-at-pieces for live troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User is yet to respond and schedule a call for further assistance.

**Overall:**

The conversation shows the initial stages of troubleshooting the reported issue with Pieces Core Services. The team has acknowledged the problem, proposed a solution, and is awaiting the user's response.

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot Service Inaccessible
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot Service inaccessibility with error messages related to dependency registration or core services. Troubleshooting steps include checking installation, Pieces OS version compatibility, and core dependencies. Solutions involve ensuring proper dependency registration, version compatibility, and seeking support through GitHub issues or video calls with the Pieces team.

common_issues.title: Non-Dismissable Overlay Message in Pieces
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing a non-dismissable overlay message related to Pieces Core Services, often after a background update. This issue prevents access to the application. Proposed solutions include restarting the computer, checking for updates, and engaging in live troubleshooting with the Pieces support team.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* ThemePark reported an issue where they were unable to open Pieces Core Services.
* The issue was routed to the appropriate Pieces team member for further investigation.
* ThemePark confirmed they are using Windows 10 and have Pieces Suite, OS, and Desktop installed.

**Problems Identified:**

* ThemePark was unable to open Pieces Core Services.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack Myers (Pieces Support) asked for additional information about the issue, including Windows version and confirmation of Pieces installation details.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently being investigated by the Pieces team. 
* No further updates are available at this time. 

**Additional Information:**

* The mentioned related issues and resources might be helpful in understanding potential causes and solutions for this problem. 

## Next Steps:

* The Pieces team will continue investigating the issue.
* ThemePark should monitor the issue for updates and provide any additional information requested by the Pieces team.

recommendations: **Prioritize Pieces OS Connection Issues:** Investigate and resolve the root cause of the "Connection refused" and "Route not found" errors related to Pieces OS port changes. Update documentation and communication to users regarding the new port range.

**Address Pieces Copilot Service Accessibility:** Investigate and address the issues preventing users from accessing Pieces Copilot Service on Linux and Windows. This includes resolving dependency conflicts, clarifying installation processes, and providing solutions for service launch errors.

**Improve Handling of Non-Dismissable Overlay Messages:** Investigate the cause of the non-dismissable overlay message related to Pieces Core Services and implement a solution to prevent it from recurring. This may involve improving update mechanisms or providing users with a clear way to dismiss the message.

**Enhance Communication on Port Changes:**  Clearly communicate any port changes in Pieces OS to users through release notes, documentation updates, and in-app notifications. Provide clear instructions on how to update their configurations.

**Provide Troubleshooting Steps for Copilot Service:** Create comprehensive troubleshooting documentation for Pieces Copilot Service, addressing common issues such as dependency registration errors, installation problems, and version compatibility.
